org.jodah.concurrentunit

Class Waiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jodah.concurrentunit.Waiter

  • public class Waiter
extends Object
    Waits on a test, carrying out assertions, until being resumed.

    • Field Summary

      protected Throwable failure 
      protected AtomicInteger waitCount

      • await

        public void await()
           throws Throwable
        Waits until resume() is called, or the test is failed.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        Throwable - the last reported test failure

      • await

        public void await(long waitDuration)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the waitDuration has elapsed, resume() is called, or the test is failed. Delegates to sleep(long) to avoid spurious wakeups.
        Throws:
        Throwable
        See Also:
        sleep(long)

      • await

        public void await(long waitDuration,
         int resumeThreshold)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the waitDuration has elapsed, resume() is called resumeThreshold times, or the test is failed. Delegates to sleep(long, int) to avoid spurious wakeups.
        Parameters:
        waitDuration - Duration to wait
        resumeThreshold - Number of times resume() must be called before wait is interrupted
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - the last reported test failure

      • fail

        public void fail()
        Fails the current test.

      • fail

        public void fail(String reason)
        Fails the current test for the given reason.

      • fail

        public void fail(Throwable reason)
        Fails the current test with the given reason.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Decrements the wait count, resuming the test thread when resume() calls have exceeded the resume threshold given when the test was made to wait.

      • resume

        public void resume(Thread thread)
        Resumes the waiter if thread is not the mainThread, the waitCount is null or the decremented waitCount is 0.

        Note: This method is likely not very useful to call directly since a concurrent run of a test case resulting in the need to resume from a separate thread would yield no correlation between the initiating thread and the thread where the resume call takes place.

        Parameters:
        thread - Thread to resume

      • sleep

        public void sleep(long sleepDuration)
           throws Throwable
        Sleeps until the sleepDuration has elapsed, resume() is called, or the test is failed.
        Parameters:
        sleepDuration -
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if the sleep operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - the last reported test failure

      • sleep

        public void sleep(long sleepDuration,
         int resumeThreshold)
           throws Throwable
        Sleeps until the sleepDuration has elapsed, resume() is called resumeThreshold times, or the test is failed.
        Throws:
        Throwable
        See Also:
        await(long, int)
